content.description: Adventure style climb through sharp plants. Cruxes are at the start (for shorter climbers) and near the top.
content.protection: 8 bolts (5 shared with Sugar) plus a three bolt anchor with chains
content.location: This route marks the beginning of the Painted Canyon climbing area and is directly across from where Painted Canyon feeds into the Pecos River on the other side of the canyon.  It is the right variation which shares 5 bolts with Spice directly to its left.

content.description: Spice is a variation of Sugar and is fairly overgrown as of March 21.  The last five bolts are shared with Sugar to its right.  Start 5-7 feet left for the first three bolts and then finish to a three bolt anchor.
content.protection: 8 bolts (5 of which are shared with Sugar) plus a three bolt anchor with chains.
content.location: Directly across from where Painted Canyon feeds into the Pecos River on the other side.

content.description: Three bolts protect a sharp overhung crux and lead you to a dirty ledge.  Helmets on for belayers!.  Easy terrain up top and a bit of route finding up ledgy blocks to an anchor.
content.protection: 7 bolts plus a two bolt anchor with chains
content.location: Only five paces left of Spice start variation is a line of pockets leading up through light colored limestone through a steep opening.  These three climbs are directly across from where Painted Canyon feeds into the Pecos River.

content.description: Directly opposing Painted Canyon, this pair of routes marks the beginning of the Painted Canyon Sector.
